sp.speaker: Jack.
sp.p: Gwendolen--Cecily--it is very painful for me to be forced to speak the truth. It is the first time in my life that I have ever been reduced to such a painful position, and I am really quite inexperienced in doing anything of the kind. However, I will tell you quite frankly that I have no brother Ernest. I have no brother at all. I never had a brother in my life, and I certainly have not the smallest intention of ever having one in the future.

sp.speaker: Gwendolen.
sp.p: Had you never a brother of any kind?

sp.speaker: Jack.
sp.p: Never. Not even of any kind.

sp.speaker: Gwendolen.
sp.p: I am afraid it is quite clear, Cecily, that neither of us is engaged to be married to any one.

sp.speaker: Cecily.
sp.p: It is not a very pleasant position for a young girl suddenly to find herself in. Is it?

sp.speaker: Gwendolen.
sp.p: Let us go into the house. They will hardly venture to come after us there. We will make sure that they get their comeuppance -- swift justice is the only way, wouldn't you say?
